title: Amid opt-out rumors, Sam Kennedy says Alex Bregman ‘wants to be here’ with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman may opt out of his Red Sox contract after the 2025 season to pursue free agency.
Red Sox president Sam Kennedy says Bregman wants to stay in Boston, countering rumors of a potential opt-out.
Bregman has performed well this season, hitting .279 with 16 home runs and 57 RBIs over 101 games.

title: Bill Belichick says in new book that Tom Brady made ‘right decision’ to leave Patriots in 2020
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick said Tom Brady made the right decision to leave the Patriots in 2020 for another Super Bowl contender.
Belichick cited financial constraints and poor roster management as factors that led to Brady's departure from New England.
Brady's relationship with Belichick and the Patriots' struggling performance contributed to his move to the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

title: West Boylston town administrator fired after Trump flag dispute sues town
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Former West Boylston town administrator James Ryan sues town for wrongful termination after a Trump flag dispute.
Ryan claims in the lawsuit that he was fired for enforcing state ethics laws regarding political signage on public property.
Ryan seeks over $1.3 million in damages, alleging retaliation by the town following issues with Police Chief Dennis Minnich.

title: 18-year-old injured in R.I. after lighting himself on fire for TikTok challenge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An 18-year-old sustained severe burns after attempting a TikTok fire challenge in North Smithfield, R.I.
The incident involved pouring gasoline on themselves and jumping into Slatersville Reservoir from a railroad trestle.
The 16-year-old accompanying him was unharmed; both tried to replicate a challenge seen on Instagram.

title: ‘Fear and uncertainty’: Everett officials cancel Hispanic Heritage Month festival amid ICE crackdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Everett officials cancelled the Fiesta Del Rio due to recent ICE raids creating fear in the community.
The Hispanic Heritage Month event was planned for Sept. 20 at Rivergreen Park and featured local vendors and performances.
Mayor Carlo DeMaria stated that it was not appropriate to hold the festival amidst community safety concerns.

title: Josh Kraft ends mayoral campaign after coming in second by nearly 50 points in Tuesday’s preliminary
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Josh Kraft ends his Boston mayoral campaign after losing to Mayor Michelle Wu by nearly 50 points in the preliminary election.
Kraft, 57, who led philanthropic organizations, announced his departure despite out-raising Wu, spending $5.5 million of personal funds.
Kraft pledges $3 million to address Boston's humanitarian crisis as he shifts focus from campaigning to civic issues.

title: Josh McDaniels defends Drake Maye: ‘He’s the right guy’ for Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Josh McDaniels defends Drake Maye, emphasizing the Patriots' long-term vision for him as a key player.
Drake Maye's debut performance faced criticism after a Patriots' loss, raising concerns about his readiness.
McDaniels insists the offensive playbook hasn't overwhelmed Maye, attributing struggles to typical learning curves.

title: Authorities in a Connecticut town want to speak with whoever is painting the squirrels
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Two squirrels in East Hartford, Connecticut, were found painted red and blue near Naubuc Avenue and High Street.
East Hartford Animal Control is working with wildlife rehabilitators to determine the best way to help the painted squirrels.
Officials seek information from the public about the incident and ask witnesses to call 860-291-7572.

title: 2 Mass. teachers reportedly on leave for reactions to Charlie Kirk’s death
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Two Massachusetts teachers placed on leave after social media reactions to Charlie Kirk's death drew police presence.
Wachusett teacher allegedly wrote 'We're not offering sympathy' on Instagram; Framingham teacher sang 'God Bless America'.
Both districts condemned the teachers' actions and emphasized commitment to safe, respectful environments amid Kirk's contentious death.

title: A top return from Bruins’ roster teardown, prospect Fraser Minten is looking to stick in NHL
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten, a promising 21-year-old center, aims to secure a roster spot with the Boston Bruins for the 2025-26 season.
The Bruins acquired Minten and draft picks from Toronto during a roster overhaul involving trades of key players like Brad Marchand and Brandon Carlo.
Minten, known for his versatile skills, has played 25 NHL games and will lead the Bruins in the 2025 Prospects Challenge in Buffalo.
